definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
(used in given names)/variant of 奔[ben1]
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: He hunted high and law for a job.
The purchasing agent rushes around every day to secure materials.
sentences.chinese: 采购员天天为备料东奔西走。

sentences.english: Favor stillness over a buzz of activity.
sentences.chinese: 在东奔西走的活动中寻觅一份安宁。

sentences.english: He kicked around a good deal before settling down.
sentences.chinese: 他东奔西走了好一阵才定居下来。

sentences.english: I've run around the office all day. I'm exhausted!
sentences.chinese: 我一整天都在办公室里东奔西走，实在困极了。

sentences.english: With this kind of job, I am 'sways on the move.
sentences.chinese: 为了这个就业，我每天东奔西走。

definition: to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
to run/to rush about/to be on the go
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to work hard/to look after
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
day and night/regardless of the time of day or night
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to feel apprehensive/to be alarmed
